location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No 557 of 1823 from William Newnham, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay to Captain John Macleod, Resident in the Persian Gulph [Persian Gulf]

mods.abstract: The letter is explaining that the nature of the relationship between the British and Sa‘īd bin Sultān Āl Sa‘īd, the Imam of Muscat, should be made clear to the latter; the British regard military co-operation between them to extend to the suppression of piracy only, and that it does not constitute an alliance against each other's political enemies.
